alert.note: Alert for Harper; Kingman; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 5:00PM CDT until July 14 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN SEDGWICK...NORTHERN HARPER...SOUTHERN KINGMAN AND NORTHWESTERN SUMNER COUNTIES... At 500 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sharon to near Harper to near Conway Springs, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Norwich, Zenda, Spivey, Rago and Runnymede. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
